description: Please contact Dr. Steven Wilhelm (wilhelm@utk.edu) for additional information regarding this protocol.

groups.group_name: The Aquatic Microbial Ecology Research Group - AMERG (The Buchan, Zinser and Wilhelm labs)

components.data: Grow a culture of E.coli ATCC11303 in LB media overnight
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Grow a culture of E.coli ATCC11303 in LB media overnight

components.data: The next morning, prewarm LB-agar plates to 37ºC
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The next morning, prewarm LB-agar plates to 37ºC

components.data: Pellet 1 mL of the cells in an Eppendorf tube at 10,000 xg, 2 min
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pellet 1 mL of the cells in an Eppendorf tube at 10,000 xg, 2 min
Discard the medium

components.data: Resuspend the pellet into 1 mL 10 mM MgSO4
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend the pellet into 1 mL 10 mM MgSO4
Melt 0.6% top agar in the microwave

components.data: Prepare sterile 5 mL tubes and pipet 3 mL of melted top agar into them
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare sterile 5 mL tubes and pipet 3 mL of melted top agar into them

components.data: Keep tubes in 45ºC heat block or water bath so that the agar stays in a liquid state, but not too hot to kill the cells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Keep tubes in 45ºC heat block or water bath so that the agar stays in a liquid state, but not too hot to kill the cells.

components.data: Add 10 µL T5 from the stock (except the control) to 100 µL of resuspended cells
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 10 µL T5 from the stock (except the control) to 100 µL of resuspended cells
Incubate 5 min at room temperature

components.data: Add the infected cells to the molton top agar
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add the infected cells to the molton top agar
Vortex briefly

components.data: Pour onto prewarmed LB agar plate and tilt the plate to spread
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pour onto prewarmed LB agar plate and tilt the plate to spread
Let top agar solidify ~30-60 min
Evert plates and return to 37ºC incubator
Let grow ~6-8 hrs

components.data: When confluent plaques are seen on the plate, add 5 mL of sterile phage buffer (10 mM MgSO4; 1 mM CaCl2; 10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 7.5; 1% gelatin)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When confluent plaques are seen on the plate, add 5 mL of sterile phage buffer (10 mM MgSO4; 1 mM CaCl2; 10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 7.5; 1% gelatin)

components.data: Let the plates sit overnight at 4ºC with the buffer on top to gather the phages
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Let the plates sit overnight at 4ºC with the buffer on top to gather the phages

components.data: The next day, transfer the liquid from the plates to a sterile tube and add 100 µL chloroform and 5 mL phage buffer
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The next day, transfer the liquid from the plates to a sterile tube and add 100 µL chloroform and 5 mL phage buffer

components.data: Shake for 1 min to let chloroform settle out
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Shake for 1 min to let chloroform settle out

components.data: Transfer 4 mL of the supernatant to a fresh tube
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer 4 mL of the supernatant to a fresh tube

components.data: Filter the solution with 0.22 µm pore size syringe filter to get rid of all the cellular debris
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Filter the solution with 0.22 µm pore size syringe filter to get rid of all the cellular debris

components.data: Store phage at 4ºC. They will stay infective for >1 yr.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Store phage at 4ºC. They will stay infective for >1 yr.
Please contact Dr. Steven Wilhelm (wilhelm@utk.edu) for additional information regarding this protocol.

groups.group_name: The Aquatic Microbial Ecology Research Group - AMERG (The Buchan, Zinser and Wilhelm labs)

components.data: Pellet phage in an ultracentrifuge at 28,000 rpm, 90 min, 10ºC in 35 mL polycarbonate tubes, filled to the rim, balanced with phage buffer so that the difference is <0.01 g.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pellet phage in an ultracentrifuge at 28,000 rpm, 90 min, 10ºC in 35 mL polycarbonate tubes, filled to the rim, balanced with phage buffer so that the difference is <0.01 g.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of untitled protocol
source_data.annotation: Use the SW-28 rotor, or equivalent, cooled down in the fridge prior to using.
source_data.thread_text: Use the SW-28 rotor, or equivalent, cooled down in the fridge prior to using.
source_data.body: Use the SW-28 rotor, or equivalent, cooled down in the fridge prior to using.

source_data.description: Discard the supernatant
Resuspend the pellet with phage buffer

components.data: If the pellet still seems to have some cellular debris in it, filter the resuspension using a 1 mL syringe and a small 0.2 µm pore size syringe filter.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: If the pellet still seems to have some cellular debris in it, filter the resuspension using a 1 mL syringe and a small 0.2 µm pore size syringe filter.

components.data: Re-pellet the viruses in a Beckmann TL-100 ultracentrifuge at 35,000 rpm, 2 hr, 6ºC using the TL-55 rotor cooled down befoer use using 1.4 mL polycarbonate tubes, filled and balanced as the bigger tubes in step 1.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Re-pellet the viruses in a Beckmann TL-100 ultracentrifuge at 35,000 rpm, 2 hr, 6ºC using the TL-55 rotor cooled down befoer use using 1.4 mL polycarbonate tubes, filled and balanced as the bigger tubes in step 1.

components.data: Resuspend the pellet with phage buffer and transfer into 1.5 mL screw cap tubes
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend the pellet with phage buffer and transfer into 1.5 mL screw cap tubes
Store at 4ºC

components.data: Add YO-PRO stain to each tube containing 100 µL resuspension
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add YO-PRO stain to each tube containing 100 µL resuspension

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 8 of untitled protocol
source_data.annotation: Make sure to work in the dark, because the stain is photosensitive.
source_data.thread_text: Make sure to work in the dark, because the stain is photosensitive.
source_data.body: Make sure to work in the dark, because the stain is photosensitive.

components.data: Cover the tubes with aluminum foil and let sit at 4ºC for 48 hrs
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cover the tubes with aluminum foil and let sit at 4ºC for 48 hrs

components.data: After incubation, increase the volume to 1.4 mL
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After incubation, increase the volume to 1.4 mL

components.data: Centrifuge in the Beckmann TL-100 as in step 5
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge in the Beckmann TL-100 as in step 5
Discard the supernatant
Suspend the viruses in Milli-Q water
